member.summary: Exposes methods that allow a client to retrieve the icon that is associated with one of the objects in a folder.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IExtractIconA.GetIconLocation(SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.Int32@,SharpShell.Interop.GILOutFlags@)
member.summary: Gets the location and index of an icon.
member.param: One or more of the following values. This parameter can also be NULL.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the icon location. The icon location is a null-terminated string that identifies the file that contains the icon.
The size of the buffer, in characters, pointed to by pszIconFile.
A pointer to an int that receives the index of the icon in the file pointed to by pszIconFile.
A pointer to a UINT value that receives zero or a combination of the following value

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IExtractIconA.Extract(System.String,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Extracts an icon image from the specified location.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the icon location.
The index of the icon in the file pointed to by pszFile.
A pointer to an HICON value that receives the handle to the large icon. This parameter may be NULL.
A pointer to an HICON value that receives the handle to the small icon. This parameter may be NULL.

The desired size of the icon, in pixels. The low word contains the size of the large icon, and the high word contains the size of the small icon. The size specified can be the width or height. The width of an icon always equals its height.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the function extracted the icon, or S_FALSE if the calling application should extract the icon.

member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Helpers.ComStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Helpers.ComStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Helpers.ComStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Helpers.ComStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.summary: The COM stream instance.

member.name: T:SharpShell.InitializeWithStreamServer
member.summary: InitializeWithStreamServer provides a base for SharpShell Servers that must implement IInitializeWithStream (thumbnail handlers, etc).

member.name: T:SharpShell.SharpShellServer
member.summary:
The SharpShellServer class is the base class for all SharpShellServers. It provides the core standard functionality - registration, unregistration, identity information (as required by ISharpShellServer), MEF contract inheritance and definitions of virtual functions that can be overriden by advanced users to hook into key points in Server Lifecycle.
Note that ALL derived classes will Export ISharpShellServer - this is a useful feature as it means that the ServerManager tool (and other tools) can interrogate assemblies via MEF to get information on servers they contain.

member.param: The type.

member.summary: Actually performs registration. The ComRegisterFunction decorated method will call this function internally with the flag appropriate for the operating system processor architecture. However, this function can also be called manually if needed.
member.param: The type of object to register, this must be a SharpShellServer derived class.

member.param: The type of object to unregister, this must be a SharpShellServer derived class.
Type of the registration to unregister.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS
member.summary: Where to obtain association data and the form the data is stored in. One of the following values from the ASSOCCLASS enumeration.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_SHELL_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member names a key found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\SystemFileAssociations\hkClass.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_PROGID_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member provides the full registry path of a ProgID.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_PROGID_STR
member.summary: The pszClass member names a ProgID found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\pszClass.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_CLSID_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member provides the full registry path of a CLSID.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_CLSID_STR
member.summary: The hkClass member names a CLSID found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\CLSID\pszClass.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_APP_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member provides the full registry path of an application identifier (APPID).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_APP_STR
member.summary: The APPID storing the application information is found at HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Applications\FileName where FileName is obtained by sending pszClass to PathFindFileName.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_SYSTEM_STR
member.summary: The pszClass member names a key found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\SystemFileAssociations\pszClass.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_FOLDER
member.summary: Use the association information for folders stored under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Folder. When this flag is set, hkClass and pszClass are ignored.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_STAR
member.summary: Use the association information stored under the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\* subkey. When this flag is set, hkClass and pszClass are ignored.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_FIXED_PROGID_STR
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. Do not use the user defaults to apply the mapping of the class specified by the pszClass member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_PROTOCOL_STR
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. Use the user defaults to apply the mapping of the class specified by the pszClass member; the class is a protocol.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCIATIONELEMENT
member.summary: Defines information used by AssocCreateForClasses to retrieve an IQueryAssociations interface for a given file association.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCIATIONELEMENT.ac
member.summary: Where to obtain association data and the form the data is stored in. One of the following values from the ASSOCCLASS enumeration.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCIATIONELEMENT.hkClass
member.summary: A registry key that specifies a class that contains association information.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.ASSOCIATIONELEMENT.pszClass
member.summary: A pointer to the name of a class that contains association information.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.Gdi32.DeleteObject(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Deletes a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette, freeing all system resources associated with the object. After the object is deleted, the specified handle is no longer valid.
member.param: A handle to a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the specified handle is not valid or is currently selected into a DC, the return value is false.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.Gdi32.DeleteDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Deletes the specified device context (DC).
member.param: A handle to the device context.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.Gdi32.GetDIBits(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],SharpShell.Interop.BITMAPINFO@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the bits of the specified compatible bitmap and copies them into a buffer as a DIB using the specified format.
member.param: A handle to the device context.
A handle to the bitmap. This must be a compatible bitmap (DDB).
The first scan line to retrieve.
The number of scan lines to retrieve.
A pointer to a buffer to receive the bitmap data. If this parameter is , the function passes the dimensions and format of the bitmap to the structure pointed to by the parameter.
A pointer to a structure that specifies the desired format for the DIB data.
The format of the bmiColors member of the structure. It must be one of the following values.
member.returns: If the lpvBits parameter is non-NULL and the function succeeds, the return value is the number of scan lines copied from the bitmap. If the lpvBits parameter is NULL and GetDIBits successfully fills the structure, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. This function can return the following value: ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER (87 (0Ã—57))

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.BITMAPINFO.bmiHeader
member.summary: A BITMAPINFOHEADER structure that contains information about the dimensions of color format.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.BITMAPINFO.bmiColors
member.summary: An array of RGBQUAD. The elements of the array that make up the color table.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.CATEGORYINFO
member.summary: Describes a component category.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.CATEGORYINFO.catid
member.summary: The category identifier for the component.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.CATEGORYINFO.lcid
member.summary: The locale identifier. See Language Identifier Constants and Strings.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.CATEGORYINFO.szDescription
member.summary: The description of the category (cannot exceed 128 characters).

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU
member.summary: Contains context menu information used by SHCreateDefaultContextMenu.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.hwnd
member.summary: A handle to the context menu. Set this member to the handle returned from CreateMenu.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.pcmcb
member.summary: A pointer to the IContextMenuCB interface supported by the callback object. This value is optional and can be NULL.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.pidlFolder
member.summary: The PIDL of the folder that contains the selected file object(s) or the folder of the context menu if no file objects are selected. This value is optional and can be NULL, in which case the PIDL is computed from the psf member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.psf
member.summary: A pointer to the IShellFolder interface of the folder object that contains the selected file objects, or the folder that contains the context menu if no file objects are selected.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.cidl
member.summary: The count of items in member apidl.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.apidl
member.summary: A pointer to a constant array of ITEMIDLIST structures. Each entry in the array describes a child item to which the context menu applies, for instance, a selected file the user wants to Open.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.punkAssociationInfo
member.summary: A pointer to the IQueryAssociations interface on the object from which to load extensions. This parameter is optional and thus can be NULL. If this value is NULL and members aKeys and cKeys are also NULL (see Remarks), punkAssociationInfo is computed from the apidl member and cidl via a request for IQueryAssociations through IShellFolder::GetUIObjectOf. If IShellFolder::GetUIObjectOf returns E_NOTIMPL, a default implementation is provided based on the SFGAO_FOLDER and SFGAO_FILESYSTEM attributes returned from IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DEFCONTEXTMENU.aKeys
member.summary: A pointer to an HKEY that specifies the registry key from which to load extensions. This parameter is optional and can be NULL. If the value is NULL, the extensions are loaded based on the object that supports interface IQueryAssociations as specified in punkAssociationInfo.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO
member.summary: Receives information about a band object. This structure is used with the deprecated IDeskBand::GetBandInfo method.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.dwMask
member.summary: Set of flags that determine which members of this structure are being requested.
member.remarks: This will be a combination of the following values: DBIM_MINSIZE ptMinSize is being requested. DBIM_MAXSIZE ptMaxSize is being requested. DBIM_INTEGRAL ptIntegral is being requested. DBIM_ACTUAL ptActual is being requested. DBIM_TITLE wszTitle is being requested. DBIM_MODEFLAGS dwModeFlags is being requested. DBIM_BKCOLOR crBkgnd is being requested.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.ptMinSize
member.summary: Point structure that receives the minimum size of the band object. The minimum width is placed in the x member and the minimum height is placed in the y member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: Point structure that receives the maximum size of the band object. The maximum height is placed in the y member and the x member is ignored. If there is no limit for the maximum height, (LONG)-1 should be used.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.ptIntegral
member.summary: Point structure that receives the sizing step value of the band object. The vertical step value is placed in the y member, and the x member is ignored. The step value determines in what increments the band will be resized.
member.remarks: This member is ignored if dwModeFlags does not contain DBIMF_VARIABLEHEIGHT.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.ptActual
member.summary: Point structure that receives the ideal size of the band object. The ideal width is placed in the x member and the ideal height is placed in the y member. The band container will attempt to use these values, but the band is not guaranteed to be this size.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.wszTitle
member.summary: The title of the band.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.dwModeFlags
member.summary: A value that receives a set of flags that define the mode of operation for the band object.
member.remarks: This must be one or a combination of the following values. DBIMF_NORMAL The band is normal in all respects. The other mode flags modify this flag. DBIMF_VARIABLEHEIGHT The height of the band object can be changed. The ptIntegral member defines the step value by which the band object can be resized. DBIMF_DEBOSSED The band object is displayed with a sunken appearance. DBIMF_BKCOLOR The band will be displayed with the background color specified in crBkgnd.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.crBkgnd
member.summary: The background color of the band.
member.remarks: This member is ignored if dwModeFlags does not contain the DBIMF_BKCOLOR flag.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIF
member.summary: The view mode of the band object. This is one of the following values.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIF.DBIF_VIEWMODE_NORMAL
member.summary: Band object is displayed in a horizontal band.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIF.DBIF_VIEWMODE_VERTICAL
member.summary: Band object is displayed in a vertical band.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIF.DBIF_VIEWMODE_FLOATING
member.summary: Band object is displayed in a floating band.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIF.DBIF_VIEWMODE_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Band object is displayed in a transparent band.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM
member.summary: The set of flags that determine which members of this structure are being requested by the caller. One or more of the following values:

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM.DBIM_MINSIZE
member.summary: ptMinSize is requested.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM.DBIM_MAXSIZE
member.summary: ptMaxSize is requested.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM.DBIM_INTEGRAL
member.summary: ptIntegral is requested.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM.DBIM_ACTUAL
member.summary: ptActual is requested.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM.DBIM_TITLE
member.summary: wszTitle is requested.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM.DBIM_MODEFLAGS
member.summary: dwModeFlags is requested.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIM.DBIM_BKCOLOR
member.summary: crBkgnd is requested.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF
member.summary: A value that receives a set of flags that specify the mode of operation for the band object. One or more of the following values:

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_NORMAL
member.summary: The band uses default properties. The other mode flags modify this flag.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_FIXED
member.summary: Windows XP and later: The band object is of a fixed sized and position. With this flag, a sizing grip is not displayed on the band object.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_FIXEDBMP
member.summary: DBIMF_FIXEDBMP Windows XP and later: The band object uses a fixed bitmap (.bmp) file as its background. Note that backgrounds are not supported in all cases, so the bitmap may not be seen even when this flag is set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_VARIABLEHEIGHT
member.summary: The height of the band object can be changed. The ptIntegral member defines the step value by which the band object can be resized.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_UNDELETEABLE
member.summary: Windows XP and later: The band object cannot be removed from the band container.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_DEBOSSED
member.summary: The band object is displayed with a sunken appearance.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_BKCOLOR
member.summary: The band is displayed with the background color specified in crBkgnd.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_USECHEVRON
member.summary: Windows XP and later: If the full band object cannot be displayed (that is, the band object is smaller than ptActual, a chevron is shown to indicate that there are more options available. These options are displayed when the chevron is clicked.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_BREAK
member.summary: Windows XP and later: The band object is displayed in a new row in the band container.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_ADDTOFRONT
member.summary: Windows XP and later: The band object is the first object in the band container.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_TOPALIGN
member.summary: Windows XP and later: The band object is displayed in the top row of the band container.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_NOGRIPPER
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: No sizing grip is ever displayed to allow the user to move or resize the band object.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_ALWAYSGRIPPER
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: A sizing grip that allows the user to move or resize the band object is always shown, even if that band object is the only one in the container.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIMF.DBIMF_NOMARGINS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: The band object should not display margins.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags
member.summary: Input GIL flags.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags.GIL_ASYNC
member.summary: Set this flag to determine whether the icon should be extracted asynchronously. If the icon can be extracted rapidly, this flag is usually ignored. If extraction will take more time, GetIconLocation should return E_PENDING

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags.GIL_DEFAULTICON
member.summary: Retrieve information about the fallback icon. Fallback icons are usually used while the desired icon is extracted and added to the cache.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags.GIL_FORSHELL
member.summary: The icon is displayed in a Shell folder.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags.GIL_FORSHORTCUT
member.summary: The icon indicates a shortcut. However, the icon extractor should not apply the shortcut overlay; that will be done later. Shortcut icons are state-independent.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags.GIL_OPENICON
member.summary: The icon is in the open state if both open-state and closed-state images are available. If this flag is not specified, the icon is in the normal or closed state. This flag is typically used for folder objects.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.GILInFlags.GIL_CHECKSHIELD
member.summary: Explicitly return either GIL_SHIELD or GIL_FORCENOSHIELD in pwFlags. Do not block if GIL_ASYNC is set.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.ICatRegister
member.summary: provides methods for registering and unregistering component category information in the registry. This includes both the human-readable names of categories and the categories implemented or required by a given component or class.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICatRegister.RegisterCategories(System.UInt32,SharpShell.Interop.CATEGORYINFO[])
member.summary: Registers one or more component categories. Each component category consists of a CATID and a list of locale-dependent description strings.
member.param: The number of component categories to register.
The array of cCategories CATEGORYINFO structures. By providing the same CATID for multiple CATEGORYINFO structures, multiple locales can be registered for the same component category.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICatRegister.UnRegisterCategories(System.UInt32,System.Guid[])
member.summary: Removes the registration of one or more component categories. Each component category consists of a CATID and a list of locale-dependent description strings.
member.param: The number of cCategories CATIDs to be removed.
Identifies the categories to be removed.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICatRegister.RegisterClassImplCategories(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.Guid[])
member.summary: Registers the class as implementing one or more component categories.
member.param: The class ID of the relevent class for which category information will be set.
The number of categories to associate as category identifiers for the class.
The array of cCategories CATIDs to associate as category identifiers for the class.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICatRegister.UnRegisterClassImplCategories(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.Guid[])
member.summary: Removes one or more implemented category identifiers from a class.
member.param: The class ID of the relevant class to be manipulated.
The number of category CATIDs to remove.
The array of cCategories CATID that are to be removed. Only the category IDs specified in this array are removed.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICatRegister.RegisterClassReqCategories(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.Guid[])
member.summary: Registers the class as requiring one or more component categories.
member.param: The class ID of the relevent class for which category information will be set.
The number of category CATIDs to associate as category identifiers for the class.
The array of cCategories CATID to associate as category identifiers for the class.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICatRegister.UnRegisterClassReqCategories(System.Guid@,System.UInt32,System.Guid[])
member.summary: Removes one or more required category identifiers from a class.
member.param: The class ID of the relevent class to be manipulated.
The number of category CATIDs to remove.
The array of cCategories CATID that are to be removed. Only the category IDs specified in this array are removed.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.ICommDlgBrowser
member.summary: Exposed by the common file dialog boxes to be used when they host a Shell browser. If supported, ICommDlgBrowser exposes methods that allow a Shell view to handle several cases that require different behavior in a dialog box than in a normal Shell view. You obtain an ICommDlgBrowser interface pointer by calling QueryInterface on the IShellBrowser object.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICommDlgBrowser.OnDefaultCommand(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called when a user double-clicks in the view or presses the ENTER key.
member.param: A pointer to the view's IShellView interface.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICommDlgBrowser.OnStateChange(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called after a state, identified by the uChange parameter, has changed in the IShellView interface.
member.param: A pointer to the view's IShellView interface.
Change in the selection state. This parameter can be one of the following values.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.ICommDlgBrowser.IncludeObject(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Allows the common dialog box to filter objects that the view displays.
member.param: A pointer to the view's IShellView interface.
A PIDL, relative to the folder, that identifies the object.
member.returns: The browser should return S_OK to include the object in the view, or S_FALSE to hide it.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenuCB
member.summary: Exposes a method that enables the callback of a context menu. For example, to add a shield icon to a menuItem that requires elevation.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenuCB.CallBack(SharpShell.Interop.IShellFolder,System.IntPtr,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Enables the callback function for a context menu.
member.param: A pointer to the IShellFolder interface of the object that supports the IContextMenuCB::CallBack interface. The context menu interface is returned on a call to GetUIObjectOf.
A handle to the owner of the context menu. This value can be NULL.
A pointer to an IDataObject that contains information about a menu selection. Implement interface IDataObject, or call SHCreateDataObject for the default implementation.

A notification from the Shell's default menu implementation. For example, the default menu implementation calls DFM_MERGECONTEXTMENU to allow the implementer of IContextMenuCB::CallBack to remove, add, or disable context menu items in this callback. Use one of the following notifications.
Data specific to the notification specified in uMsg. See the individual notification page for specific requirements.
Data specific to the notification specified in uMsg. See the individual notification page for specific requirements.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IDeskBand
member.summary: Gets information about a band object.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IDockingWindow
member.summary: Exposes methods that notify the docking window object of changes, including showing, hiding, and impending removal. This interface is implemented by window objects that can be docked within the border space of a Windows Explorer window.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IOleWindow
member.summary: The IOleWindow interface provides methods that allow an application to obtain the handle to the various windows that participate in in-place activation, and also to enter and exit context-sensitive help mode.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IOleWindow.GetWindow(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to one of the windows participating in in-place activation (frame, document, parent, or in-place object window).
member.param: A pointer to a variable that receives the window handle.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IOleWindow.ContextSensitiveHelp(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether context-sensitive help mode should be entered during an in-place activation session.
member.param: TRUE if help mode should be entered; FALSE if it should be exited.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK if the help mode was entered or exited successfully, depending on the value passed in fEnterMode.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDockingWindow.ShowDW(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Instructs the docking window object to show or hide itself.
member.param: TRUE if the docking window object should show its window. FALSE if the docking window object should hide its window and return its border space by calling SetBorderSpaceDW with zero values.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDockingWindow.CloseDW(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Notifies the docking window object that it is about to be removed from the frame. The docking window object should save any persistent information at this time.
member.param: Reserved. This parameter should always be zero.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDockingWindow.ResizeBorderDW(SharpShell.Interop.RECT,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notifies the docking window object that the frame's border space has changed. In response to this method, the IDockingWindow implementation must call SetBorderSpaceDW, even if no border space is required or a change is not necessary.
member.param: Pointer to a RECT structure that contains the frame's available border space.

Pointer to the site's IUnknown interface. The docking window object should call the QueryInterface method for this interface, requesting IID_IDockingWindowSite. The docking window object then uses that interface to negotiate its border space. It is the docking window object's responsibility to release this interface when it is no longer needed.
Reserved. This parameter should always be zero.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDeskBand.GetBandInfo(System.UInt32,SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO.DBIF,SharpShell.Interop.DESKBANDINFO@)
member.summary: Gets state information for a band object.
member.param: The identifier of the band, assigned by the container. The band object can retain this value if it is required.
The view mode of the band object. One of the following values: DBIF_VIEWMODE_NORMAL, DBIF_VIEWMODE_VERTICAL, DBIF_VIEWMODE_FLOATING, DBIF_VIEWMODE_TRANSPARENT.
The pdbi.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IInputObject
member.summary: Exposes methods that change UI activation and process accelerators for a user input object contained in the Shell.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IInputObject.UIActivateIO(System.Boolean,SharpShell.Interop.MSG@)
member.summary: UI-activates or deactivates the object.

A pointer to an MSG structure that contains the message that caused the activation change. This value may be NULL.

member.summary: Determines if one of the object's windows has the keyboard focus.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IInputObjectSite.OnFocusChangeIS(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Informs the browser that the focus has changed.

Indicates if the object has gained or lost the focus. If this value is nonzero, the object has gained the focus. If this value is zero, the object has lost the focus.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IPersistIDList
member.summary: Exposes methods that are used to persist item identifier lists.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IPersist
member.summary: Provides the CLSID of an object that can be stored persistently in the system. Allows the object to specify which object handler to use in the client process, as it is used in the default implementation of marshaling.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IPersist.GetClassID(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Retrieves the class identifier (CLSID) of the object.
member.param: A pointer to the location that receives the CLSID on return. The CLSID is a globally unique identifier (GUID) that uniquely represents an object class that defines the code that can manipulate the object's data.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is S_OK. Otherwise, it is E_FAIL.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IPersistIDList.SetIDList(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets a persisted item identifier list.
member.param: A pointer to the item identifier list to set.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IPersistIDList.GetIDList(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Gets an item identifier list.
member.param: The address of a pointer to the item identifier list to get.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IPersistStream
member.summary: Enables the saving and loading of objects that use a simple serial stream for their storage needs.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IPersistStream.Load(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes an object from the stream where it was saved previously.
member.param: An IStream pointer to the stream from which the object should be loaded.
member.returns: This method can return the following values. S_OK, E_OUTOFMEMORY, E_FAIL.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IPersistStream.Save(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves an object to the specified stream.
member.param: An IStream pointer to the stream into which the object should be saved.
Indicates whether to clear the dirty flag after the save is complete. If TRUE, the flag should be cleared. If FALSE, the flag should be left unchanged.
member.returns: This method can return the following values. S_OK, STG_E_CANTSAVE, STG_E_MEDIUMFULL.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IPersistStream.GetSizeMax(System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the stream needed to save the object.
member.param: The size in bytes of the stream needed to save this object, in bytes.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK to indicate that the size was retrieved successfully.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.MEASUREITEMSTRUCT
member.summary: Informs the system of the dimensions of an owner-drawn control or menu item. This allows the system to process user interaction with the control correctly.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MEASUREITEMSTRUCT.CtlType
member.summary: The control type. This member can be one of the values shown in the following table.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MEASUREITEMSTRUCT.CtlID
member.summary: The identifier of the combo box or list box. This member is not used for a menu.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MEASUREITEMSTRUCT.itemID
member.summary: The identifier for a menu item or the position of a list box or combo box item. This value is specified for a list box only if it has the LBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE style; this value is specified for a combo box only if it has the CBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE style.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MEASUREITEMSTRUCT.itemWidth
member.summary: The width, in pixels, of a menu item. Before returning from the message, the owner of the owner-drawn menu item must fill this member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MEASUREITEMSTRUCT.itemHeight
member.summary: The height, in pixels, of an individual item in a list box or a menu. Before returning from the message, the owner of the owner-drawn combo box, list box, or menu item must fill out this member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MEASUREITEMSTRUCT.itemData
member.summary: The application-defined value associated with the menu item. For a control, this member specifies the value last assigned to the list box or combo box by the LB_SETITEMDATA or CB_SETITEMDATA message. If the list box or combo box has the LB_HASSTRINGS or CB_HASSTRINGS style, this value is initially zero. Otherwise, this value is initially the value passed to the list box or combo box in the lParam parameter of one of the following messages:

members.member: CSIDL (constant special item ID list) values provide a unique system-independent way to identify special folders used frequently by applications, but which may not have the same name or location on any given system. For example, the system folder may be "C:\Windows" on one system and "C:\Winnt" on another. These constants are defined in Shlobj.h. v

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.EXTRASEARCH.wszFriendlyName
member.summary: A Unicode string containing the search object's friendly name. It will be used to identify the search engine on the Search Assistant menu.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.EXTRASEARCH.wszUrl
member.summary: The URL that will be displayed in the search pane.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE
member.summary: File attributes are metadata values stored by the file system on disk and are used by the system and are available to developers via various file I/O APIs. For a list of related APIs and topics, see the See Also section.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE
member.summary: A file or directory that is an archive file or directory. Applications typically use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_COMPRESSED
member.summary: A file or directory that is compressed. For a file, all of the data in the file is compressed. For a directory, compression is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DEVICE
member.summary: This value is reserved for system use.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY
member.summary: The handle that identifies a directory.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ENCRYPTED
member.summary: A file or directory that is encrypted. For a file, all data streams in the file are encrypted. For a directory, encryption is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN
member.summary: The file or directory is hidden. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_INTEGRITY_STREAM
member.summary: The directory or user data stream is configured with integrity (only supported on ReFS volumes). It is not included in an ordinary directory listing. The integrity setting persists with the file if it's renamed. If a file is copied the destination file will have integrity set if either the source file or destination directory have integrity set. Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, and Windows XP: This flag is not supported until Windows Server 2012.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL
member.summary: A file that does not have other attributes set. This attribute is valid only when used alone.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NOT_CONTENT_INDEXED
member.summary: The file or directory is not to be indexed by the content indexing service.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NO_SCRUB_DATA
member.summary: The user data stream not to be read by the background data integrity scanner (AKA scrubber). When set on a directory it only provides inheritance. This flag is only supported on Storage Spaces and ReFS volumes. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing. Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, and Windows XP: This flag is not supported until Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OFFLINE
member.summary: The data of a file is not available immediately. This attribute indicates that the file data is physically moved to offline storage. This attribute is used by Remote Storage, which is the hierarchical storage management software. Applications should not arbitrarily change this attribute.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY
member.summary: A file that is read-only. Applications can read the file, but cannot write to it or delete it. This attribute is not honored on directories. For more information, see You cannot view or change the Read-only or the System attributes of folders in Windows Server 2003, in Windows XP, in Windows Vista or in Windows 7.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_REPARSE_POINT
member.summary: A file or directory that has an associated reparse point, or a file that is a symbolic link.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SPARSE_FILE
member.summary: A file that is a sparse file.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM
member.summary: A file or directory that the operating system uses a part of, or uses exclusively.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_TEMPORARY
member.summary: A file that is being used for temporary storage. File systems avoid writing data back to mass storage if sufficient cache memory is available, because typically, an application deletes a temporary file after the handle is closed. In that scenario, the system can entirely avoid writing the data. Otherwise, the data is written after the handle is closed.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FILE_ATTRIBUTE.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_VIRTUAL
member.summary: This value is reserved for system use.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS
member.summary: A set of flags that specify folder view options. The flags are independent of each other and can be used in any combination.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NONE
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. No special view options.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_AUTOARRANGE
member.summary: Automatically arrange the elements in the view. This implies LVS_AUTOARRANGE if the list-view control is used to implement the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ABBREVIATEDNAMES
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SNAPTOGRID
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_OWNERDATA
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_BESTFITWINDOW
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_DESKTOP
member.summary: Make the folder behave like the desktop. This value applies only to the desktop and is not used for typical Shell folders. This flag implies FWF_NOCLIENTEDGE and FWF_NOSCROLL.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SINGLESEL
member.summary: Do not allow more than a single item to be selected. This is used in the common dialog boxes.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOSUBFOLDERS
member.summary: Do not show subfolders.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Draw transparently. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOCLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOSCROLL
member.summary: Do not add scroll bars. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ALIGNLEFT
member.summary: The view should be left-aligned. This implies LVS_ALIGNLEFT if the list-view control is used to implement the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOICONS
member.summary: The view should not display icons.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SHOWSELALWAYS
member.summary: This flag is deprecated as of Windows XP and has no effect. Always show the selection.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOVISIBLE
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SINGLECLICKACTIVATE
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOWEBVIEW
member.summary: The view should not be shown as a web view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_HIDEFILENAMES
member.summary: The view should not display file names.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_CHECKSELECT
member.summary: Turns on the check mode for the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOENUMREFRESH
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not re-enumerate the view (or drop the current contents of the view) when the view is refreshed.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOGROUPING
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not allow grouping in the view

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_FULLROWSELECT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. When an item is selected, the item and all its sub-items are highlighted.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOFILTERS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not display filters in the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOCOLUMNHEADER
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not display a column header in the view in any view mode.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOHEADERINALLVIEWS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Only show the column header in details view mode.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_EXTENDEDTILES
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. When the view is in "tile view mode" the layout of a single item should be extended to the width of the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_TRICHECKSELECT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Not supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_AUTOCHECKSELECT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Items can be selected using checkboxes.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOBROWSERVIEWSTATE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The view should not save view state in the browser.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SUBSETGROUPS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The view should list the number of items displayed in each group. To be used with IFolderView2::SetGroupSubsetCount.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_USESEARCHFOLDER
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Use the search folder for stacking and searching.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ALLOWRTLREADING
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Ensure right-to-left reading layout in a right-to-left system. Without this flag, the view displays strings from left-to-right both on systems set to left-to-right and right-to-left reading layout, which ensures that file names display correctly.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERSETTINGS
member.summary: Contains folder view information.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERSETTINGS.ViewMode
member.summary: Folder view mode. One of the FOLDERVIEWMODE values.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERSETTINGS.fFlags
member.summary: A set of flags that indicate the options for the folder. This can be zero or a combination of the FOLDERFLAGS values.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE
member.summary: Specifies the folder view type.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_AUTO
member.summary: The view should determine the best option.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_FIRST

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_ICON
member.summary: The view should display medium-size icons.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_SMALLICON
member.summary: The view should display small icons.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_LIST
member.summary: Object names are displayed in a list view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_DETAILS
member.summary: Object names and other selected information, such as the size or date last updated, are shown.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_THUMBNAIL
member.summary: The view should display thumbnail icons.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_TILE
member.summary: The view should display large icons.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_THUMBSTRIP
member.summary: The view should display icons in a filmstrip format.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_CONTENT
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The view should display content mode.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_LAST
member.summary: The maximum constant value in FOLDERVIEWMODE, for validation purposes.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu2
member.summary: Exposes methods that either create or merge a shortcut (context) menu associated with a Shell object. Extends IContextMenu by adding a method that allows client objects to handle messages associated with owner-drawn menu items.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu
member.summary: Exposes methods that either create or merge a shortcut menu associated with a Shell object.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu.QueryContextMenu(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpShell.Interop.CMF)
member.summary: Adds commands to a shortcut menu.
member.param: A handle to the shortcut menu. The handler should specify this handle when adding menu items.
The zero-based position at which to insert the first new menu item.
The minimum value that the handler can specify for a menu item identifier.
The maximum value that the handler can specify for a menu item identifier.

Optional flags that specify how the shortcut menu can be changed. This parameter can be set to a combination of the following values. The remaining bits of the low-order word are reserved by the system. The high-order word can be used for context-specific communications. The CMF_RESERVED value can be used to mask the low-order word.
member.returns: If successful, returns an HRESULT value that has its severity value set to SEVERITY_SUCCESS and its code value set to the offset of the largest command identifier that was assigned, plus one. For example, if idCmdFirst is set to 5 and you add three items to the menu with command identifiers of 5, 7, and 8, the return value should be MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_SUCCESS, 0, 8 - 5 + 1). Otherwise, it returns a COM error value.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu.InvokeCommand(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Carries out the command associated with a shortcut menu item.
member.param: A pointer to a CMINVOKECOMMANDINFO or CMINVOKECOMMANDINFOEX structure containing information about the command. For further details, see the Remarks section.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu.GetCommandString(System.Int32,SharpShell.Interop.GCS,System.Int32,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets information about a shortcut menu command, including the help string and the language-independent, or canonical, name for the command.
member.param: Menu command identifier offset.
Flags specifying the information to return. This parameter can have one of the following values.
Reserved. Applications must specify NULL when calling this method and handlers must ignore this parameter when called.
The address of the buffer to receive the null-terminated string being retrieved.
Size of the buffer, in characters, to receive the null-terminated string.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu2.HandleMenuMsg(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Enables client objects of the IContextMenu interface to handle messages associated with owner-drawn menu items.
member.param: The message to be processed. In the case of some messages, such as WM_INITMENUPOPUP, WM_DRAWITEM, WM_MENUCHAR, or WM_MEASUREITEM, the client object being called may provide owner-drawn menu items.
Additional message information. The value of this parameter depends on the value of the uMsg parameter.
Additional message information. The value of this parameter depends on the value of the uMsg parameter.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu3
member.summary: Exposes methods that either create or merge a shortcut menu associated with a Shell object. Allows client objects to handle messages associated with owner-drawn menu items and extends IContextMenu2 by accepting a return value from that message handling.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IContextMenu3.HandleMenuMsg2(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Allows client objects of the IContextMenu3 interface to handle messages associated with owner-drawn menu items.
member.param: The message to be processed. In the case of some messages, such as WM_INITMENUPOPUP, WM_DRAWITEM, WM_MENUCHAR, or WM_MEASUREITEM, the client object being called may provide owner-drawn menu items.
Additional message information. The value of this parameter depends on the value of the uMsg parameter.
Additional message information. The value of this parameter depends on the value of the uMsg parameter.
The address of an LRESULT value that the owner of the menu will return from the message. This parameter can be NULL.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IDropTarget
member.summary: The IDropTarget interface is one of the interfaces you implement to provide drag-and-drop operations in your application. It contains methods used in any application that can be a target for data during a drag-and-drop operation.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDropTarget.DragEnter(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject,System.UInt32,SharpShell.Interop.POINT,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Indicates whether a drop can be accepted, and, if so, the effect of the drop.
member.param: A pointer to the IDataObject interface on the data object. This data object contains the data being transferred in the drag-and-drop operation. If the drop occurs, this data object will be incorporated into the target.

The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Possible values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A POINTL structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.

On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the DoDragDrop function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDropTarget.DragOver(System.UInt32,SharpShell.Interop.POINT,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Provides target feedback to the user and communicates the drop's effect to the DoDragDrop function so it can communicate the effect of the drop back to the source.
member.param: The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Valid values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A POINTL structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.

On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the DoDragDrop function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDropTarget.DragLeave
member.summary: Removes target feedback and releases the data object.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IDropTarget.Drop(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject,System.UInt32,SharpShell.Interop.POINT,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Incorporates the source data into the target window, removes target feedback, and releases the data object.
member.param: A pointer to the IDataObject interface on the data object being transferred in the drag-and-drop operation.

The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Possible values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A POINTL structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.

On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the DoDragDrop function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IEnumIDList
member.summary: Exposes a standard set of methods used to enumerate the pointers to item identifier lists (PIDLs) of the items in a Shell folder.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IEnumIDList.Next(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified number of item identifiers in the enumeration sequence and advances the current position by the number of items retrieved.
member.param: Number of elements in the array pointed to by the rgelt parameter.

Address of an array of ITEMIDLIST pointers that receives the item identifiers. The implementation must allocate these item identifiers using the Shell's allocator (retrieved by the SHGetMalloc function). The calling application is responsible for freeing the item identifiers using the Shell's allocator.

Address of a value that receives a count of the item identifiers actually returned in rgelt. The count can be smaller than the value specified in the celt parameter. This parameter can be NULL only if celt is one.

member.summary: Skips over the specified number of elements in the enumeration sequence.

member.summary: Returns to the beginning of the enumeration sequence.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IEnumIDList.Clone(SharpShell.Interop.IEnumIDList@)
member.summary: Creates a new item enumeration object with the same contents and state as the current one.
member.param: Address of a pointer to the new enumeration object. The calling application must eventually free the new object by calling its Release member function.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IImageList

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IImageList.Add(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IObjectWithSite
member.summary: Provides a simple way to support communication between an object and its site in the container.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IObjectWithSite.GetSite(System.Guid@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves the latest site passed using SetSite.
member.param: The IID of the interface pointer that should be returned in ppvSite.

Address of pointer variable that receives the interface pointer requested in riid. Upon successful return, *ppvSite contains the requested interface pointer to the site last seen in SetSite. The specific interface returned depends on the riid argumentâ€”in essence, the two arguments act identically to those in QueryInterface. If the appropriate interface pointer is available, the object must call AddRef on that pointer before returning successfully. If no site is available, or the requested interface is not supported, this method must *ppvSite to NULL and return a failure code.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IObjectWithSite.SetSite(System.Object)
member.summary: Enables a container to pass an object a pointer to the interface for its site.
member.param: A pointer to the IUnknown interface pointer of the site managing this object. If NULL, the object should call Release on any existing site at which point the object no longer knows its site.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

If the preview handler cannot process the keystroke message, it will offer it to the host using TranslateAccelerator. If the host processes the message, this method will return S_OK. If the host does not process the message, this method will return S_FALSE.

The address of the caller-allocated variable to receive the interface pointer of the service on successful return from this function. The caller becomes responsible for calling Release through this interface pointer when the service is no longer required.
member.returns: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IShellFolder.CompareIDs(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines the relative order of two file objects or folders, given their item identifier lists. Return value: If this method is successful, the CODE field of the HRESULT contains one of the following values (the code can be retrived using the helper function GetHResultCode): Negative A negative return value indicates that the first item should precede the second (pidl1 < pidl2). Positive A positive return value indicates that the first item should follow the second (pidl1 > pidl2). Zero A return value of zero indicates that the two items are the same (pidl1 = pidl2).
member.param: Value that specifies how the comparison should be performed. The lower Sixteen bits of lParam define the sorting rule. The upper sixteen bits of lParam are used for flags that modify the sorting rule. values can be from the SHCIDS enum
Pointer to the first item's ITEMIDLIST structure.
Pointer to the second item's ITEMIDLIST structure.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
