member.summary: There is more than one icon in pwszIconFile. The icon's index is returned through pIndex.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IThumbnailProvider
member.summary: Exposes a method for getting a thumbnail image.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IThumbnailProvider.GetThumbnail(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,SharpShell.Interop.WTS_ALPHATYPE@)
member.summary: Gets a thumbnail image and alpha type.
member.param: The maximum thumbnail size, in pixels. The Shell draws the returned bitmap at this size or smaller. The returned bitmap should fit into a square of width and height cx, though it does not need to be a square image. The Shell scales the bitmap to render at lower sizes. For example, if the image has a 6:4 aspect ratio, then the returned bitmap should also have a 6:4 aspect ratio.

When this method returns, contains a pointer to the thumbnail image handle. The image must be a DIB section and 32 bits per pixel. The Shell scales down the bitmap if its width or height is larger than the size specified by cx. The Shell always respects the aspect ratio and never scales a bitmap larger than its original size.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to one of the following values from the WTS_ALPHATYPE enumeration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.KnownFolders
member.summary: KnownFolders contain the known folder ids for windows.
member.remarks: See: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd378457.aspx For details on known folders.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG
member.summary: Specify special retrieval options for known folders. These values supersede CSIDL values, which have parallel meanings.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_SIMPLE_IDLIST
member.summary: Build a simple IDList (PIDL) This value can be used when you want to retrieve the file system path but do not specify this value if you are retrieving the localized display name of the folder because it might not resolve correctly.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_NOT_PARENT_RELATIVE
member.summary: Gets the folder's default path independent of the current location of its parent. KF_FLAG_DEFAULT_PATH must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_DEFAULT_PATH
member.summary: Gets the default path for a known folder. If this flag is not set, the function retrieves the currentâ€”and possibly redirectedâ€”path of the folder. The execution of this flag includes a verification of the folder's existence unless KF_FLAG_DONT_VERIFY is set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_INIT
member.summary: Initializes the folder using its Desktop.ini settings. If the folder cannot be initialized, the function returns a failure code and no path is returned. This flag should always be combined with KF_FLAG_CREATE. If the folder is located on a network, the function might take a longer time to execute.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_NO_ALIAS
member.summary: Gets the true system path for the folder, free of any aliased placeholders such as %USERPROFILE%, returned by SHGetKnownFolderIDList and IKnownFolder::GetIDList. This flag has no effect on paths returned by SHGetKnownFolderPath and IKnownFolder::GetPath. By default, known folder retrieval functions and methods return the aliased path if an alias exists.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_DONT_UNEXPAND
member.summary: Stores the full path in the registry without using environment strings. If this flag is not set, portions of the path may be represented by environment strings such as %USERPROFILE%. This flag can only be used with SHSetKnownFolderPath and IKnownFolder::SetPath.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_DONT_VERIFY
member.summary: Do not verify the folder's existence before attempting to retrieve the path or IDList. If this flag is not set, an attempt is made to verify that the folder is truly present at the path. If that verification fails due to the folder being absent or inaccessible, the function returns a failure code and no path is returned. If the folder is located on a network, the function might take a longer time to execute. Setting this flag can reduce that lag time.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_CREATE
member.summary: Forces the creation of the specified folder if that folder does not already exist. The security provisions predefined for that folder are applied. If the folder does not exist and cannot be created, the function returns a failure code and no path is returned. This value can be used only with the following functions and methods:

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_NO_APPCONTAINER_REDIRECTION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7: When running inside an app container, or when providing an app container token, this flag prevents redirection to app container folders. Instead, it retrieves the path that would be returned where it not running inside an app container.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.KNOWN_FOLDER_FLAG.KF_FLAG_ALIAS_ONLY
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. Return only aliased PIDLs. Do not use the file system path.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.LOGFONT
member.summary: The LOGFONT structure defines the attributes of a font.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.MSG
member.summary: Contains message information from a thread's message queue.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MSG.hwnd
member.summary: A handle to the window whose window procedure receives the message. This member is NULL when the message is a thread message.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MSG.message
member.summary: The message identifier. Applications can only use the low word; the high word is reserved by the system.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MSG.wParam
member.summary: Additional information about the message. The exact meaning depends on the value of the message member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MSG.lParam
member.summary: Additional information about the message. The exact meaning depends on the value of the message member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MSG.time
member.summary: The time at which the message was posted.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.MSG.pt
member.summary: The cursor position, in screen coordinates, when the message was posted.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.NMHDR
member.summary: Contains information about a notification message.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.NMHDR.hwndFrom
member.summary: A window handle to the control sending the message.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.NMHDR.idFrom
member.summary: An identifier of the control sending the message.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.NMHDR.code
member.summary: A notification code. This member can be one of the common notification codes (see Notifications under General Control Reference), or it can be a control-specific notification code.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.PSHNOTIFY
member.summary: The notify struct for Property Sheet notifications.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSHNOTIFY.hdr
member.summary: The header.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSHNOTIFY.lParam
member.summary: The lparam

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.OLEMENUGROUPWIDTHS
member.summary: Indicates the number of menu items in each of the six menu groups of a menu shared between a container and an object server during an in-place editing session. This is the mechanism for building a shared menu.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.OLEMENUGROUPWIDTHS.width
member.summary: An array whose elements contain the number of menu items in each of the six menu groups of a shared in-place editing menu. Each menu group can have any number of menu items. The container uses elements 0, 2, and 4 to indicate the number of menu items in its File, View, and Window menu groups. The object server uses elements 1, 3, and 5 to indicate the number of menu items in its Edit, Object, and Help menu groups.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.PREVIEWHANDLERFRAMEINFO
member.summary: Accelerator table structure. Used by IPreviewHandlerFrame::GetWindowContext.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PREVIEWHANDLERFRAMEINFO.haccel
member.summary: A handle to the accelerator table.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PREVIEWHANDLERFRAMEINFO.cAccelEntries
member.summary: The number of entries in the accelerator table.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.PSN
member.summary: Property Sheet Notifications.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSN.PSN_SETACTIVE
member.summary: Notifies a page that it is about to be activated.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSN.PSN_KILLACTIVE
member.summary: Notifies a page that it is about to lose activation either because another page is being activated or the user has clicked the OK button.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSN.PSN_APPLY
member.summary: Sent to every page in the property sheet to indicate that the user has clicked the OK, Close, or Apply button and wants all changes to take effect. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSN.PSN_RESET
member.summary: Notifies a page that the property sheet is about to be destroyed.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.PSP
member.summary: Flags that indicate which options to use when creating the property sheet page. This member can be a combination of the following values.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_DEFAULT
member.summary: Uses the default meaning for all structure members. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_DLGINDIRECT
member.summary: Creates the page from the dialog box template in memory pointed to by the pResource member. The PropertySheet function assumes that the template that is in memory is not write-protected. A read-only template will cause an exception in some versions of Windows.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_USEHICON
member.summary: Uses hIcon as the small icon on the tab for the page. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_USEICONID
member.summary: Uses pszIcon as the name of the icon resource to load and use as the small icon on the tab for the page. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_USETITLE
member.summary: Uses the pszTitle member as the title of the property sheet dialog box instead of the title stored in the dialog box template. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_RTLREADING
member.summary: Reverses the direction in which pszTitle is displayed. Normal windows display all text, including pszTitle, left-to-right (LTR). For languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL), a window can be mirrored and all text will be displayed RTL. If PSP_RTLREADING is set, pszTitle will instead read RTL in a normal parent window, and LTR in a mirrored parent window.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_HASHELP
member.summary: Enables the property sheet Help button when the page is active. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_USEREFPARENT
member.summary: Maintains the reference count specified by the pcRefParent member for the lifetime of the property sheet page created from this structure.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_USECALLBACK
member.summary: Calls the function specified by the pfnCallback member when creating or destroying the property sheet page defined by this structure.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_PREMATURE
member.summary: Version 4.71 or later. Causes the page to be created when the property sheet is created. If this flag is not specified, the page will not be created until it is selected the first time. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_HIDEHEADER
member.summary: Version 5.80 and later. Causes the wizard property sheet to hide the header area when the page is selected. If a watermark has been provided, it will be painted on the left side of the page. This flag should be set for welcome and completion pages, and omitted for interior pages. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_USEHEADERTITLE
member.summary: Version 5.80 or later. Displays the string pointed to by the pszHeaderTitle member as the title in the header of a Wizard97 interior page. You must also set the PSH_WIZARD97 flag in the dwFlags member of the associated PROPSHEETHEADER structure. The PSP_USEHEADERTITLE flag is ignored if PSP_HIDEHEADER is set. This flag is not supported when using the Aero-style wizard (PSH_AEROWIZARD).

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.PSP.PSP_USEHEADERSUBTITLE
member.summary: Version 5.80 or later. Displays the string pointed to by the pszHeaderSubTitle member as the subtitle of the header area of a Wizard97 page. To use this flag, you must also set the PSH_WIZARD97 flag in the dwFlags member of the associated PROPSHEETHEADER structure. The PSP_USEHEADERSUBTITLE flag is ignored if PSP_HIDEHEADER is set. In Aero-style wizards, the title appears near the top of the client area.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP
member.summary: Flags specifying the folder to be browsed. It can be zero or one or more of the following values. These flags specify whether another window is to be created.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_DEFBROWSER
member.summary: Use default behavior, which respects the view option (the user setting to create new windows or to browse in place). In most cases, calling applications should use this flag.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_SAMEBROWSER
member.summary: Browse to another folder with the same Windows Explorer window.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_NEWBROWSER
member.summary: Creates another window for the specified folder.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_DEFMODE
member.summary: Use the current window.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_OPENMODE
member.summary: Specifies no folder tree for the new browse window. If the current browser does not match the SBSP_OPENMODE of the browse object call, a new window is opened.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_EXPLOREMODE
member.summary: Specifies a folder tree for the new browse window. If the current browser does not match the SBSP_EXPLOREMODE of the browse object call, a new window is opened.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_HELPMODE
member.summary: Not supported. Do not use.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_NOTRANSFERHIST
member.summary: Do not transfer the browsing history to the new window.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_ABSOLUTE
member.summary: An absolute PIDL, relative to the desktop.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_RELATIVE
member.summary: A relative PIDL, relative to the current folder.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_PARENT
member.summary: Browse the parent folder, ignore the PIDL.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_NAVIGATEBACK
member.summary: Navigate back, ignore the PIDL.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_NAVIGATEFORWARD
member.summary: Navigate forward, ignore the PIDL.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_ALLOW_AUTONAVIGATE
member.summary: Enable auto-navigation.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_KEEPSAMETEMPLATE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Not supported. Do not use.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_KEEPWORDWHEELTEXT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Navigate without clearing the search entry field.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_ACTIVATE_NOFOCUS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Navigate without the default behavior of setting focus into the new view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_CREATENOHISTORY
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Do not add a new entry to the travel log. When the user enters a search term in the search box and subsequently refines the query, the browser navigates forward but does not add an additional travel log entry.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_PLAYNOSOUND
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Do not make the navigation complete sound for each keystroke in the search box.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_CALLERUNTRUSTED
member.summary: Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later. The navigation was possibly initiated by a webpage with scripting code already present on the local system.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_TRUSTFIRSTDOWNLOAD
member.summary: Suppress selection in the history pane.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_UNTRUSTEDFORDOWNLOAD
member.summary: Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later. The window is navigating to an untrusted, non-HTML file. If the user attempts to download the file, do not allow the download.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_NOAUTOSELECT
member.summary: Suppress selection in the history pane.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_WRITENOHISTORY
member.summary: Write no history of this navigation in the history Shell folder.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_TRUSTEDFORACTIVEX
member.summary: Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later. The navigate should allow ActiveX prompts.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_FEEDNAVIGATION
member.summary: Windows Internet Explorer 7 and later. If allowed by current registry settings, give the browser a destination to navigate to.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SBSP.SBSP_REDIRECT
member.summary: Enables redirection to another URL.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SCHIDS
member.summary: The system currently defines these modifier flags.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SCHIDS.SCHIDS_ALLFIELDS
member.summary: Version 5.0. Compare all the information contained in the ITEMIDLIST structure, not just the display names. This flag is valid only for folder objects that support the IShellFolder2 interface. For instance, if the two items are files, the folder should compare their names, sizes, file times, attributes, and any other information in the structures. If this flag is set, the lower sixteen bits of lParam must be zero.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SCHIDS.SHCIDS_CANONICALONLY
member.summary: Version 5.0. Compare all the information contained in the ITEMIDLIST structure, not just the display names. This flag is valid only for folder objects that support the IShellFolder2 interface. For instance, if the two items are files, the folder should compare their names, sizes, file times, attributes, and any other information in the structures. If this flag is set, the lower sixteen bits of lParam must be zero.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SCHIDS.SHCIDS_BITMASK
member.summary: Bitmask for the flag field.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SCHIDS.SHCIDS_COLUMNMASK
member.summary: Bitmask for the column field.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SEE
member.summary: Flags that indicate the content and validity of the other structure members; a combination of the following values:

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_DEFAULT
member.summary: Use default values.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_CLASSNAME
member.summary: Use the class name given by the lpClass member. If both SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY and SEE_MASK_CLASSNAME are set, the class key is used.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY
member.summary: Use the class key given by the hkeyClass member. If both SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY and SEE_MASK_CLASSNAME are set, the class key is used.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_IDLIST
member.summary: Use the item identifier list given by the lpIDList member. The lpIDList member must point to an ITEMIDLIST structure.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST
member.summary: Use the IContextMenu interface of the selected item's shortcut menu handler. Use either lpFile to identify the item by its file system path or lpIDList to identify the item by its PIDL. This flag allows applications to use ShellExecuteEx to invoke verbs from shortcut menu extensions instead of the static verbs listed in the registry. Note SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST overrides and implies SEE_MASK_IDLIST.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_ICON
member.summary: Use the icon given by the hIcon member. This flag cannot be combined with SEE_MASK_HMONITOR. Note This flag is used only in Windows XP and earlier. It is ignored as of Windows Vista.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_HOTKEY
member.summary: Use the keyboard shortcut given by the dwHotKey member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_NOCLOSEPROCESS
member.summary: Use to indicate that the hProcess member receives the process handle. This handle is typically used to allow an application to find out when a process created with ShellExecuteEx terminates. In some cases, such as when execution is satisfied through a DDE conversation, no handle will be returned. The calling application is responsible for closing the handle when it is no longer needed.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_CONNECTNETDRV
member.summary: Validate the share and connect to a drive letter. This enables reconnection of disconnected network drives. The lpFile member is a UNC path of a file on a network.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_NOASYNC
member.summary: Wait for the execute operation to complete before returning. This flag should be used by callers that are using ShellExecute forms that might result in an async activation, for example DDE, and create a process that might be run on a background thread. (Note: ShellExecuteEx runs on a background thread by default if the caller's threading model is not Apartment., Calls to ShellExecuteEx from processes already running on background threads should always pass this flag. Also, applications that exit immediately after calling ShellExecuteEx should specify this flag. If the execute operation is performed on a background thread and the caller did not specify the SEE_MASK_ASYNCOK flag, then the calling thread waits until the new process has started before returning. This typically means that either CreateProcess has been called, the DDE communication has completed, or that the custom execution delegate has notified ShellExecuteEx that it is done. If the SEE_MASK_WAITFORINPUTIDLE flag is specified, then ShellExecuteEx calls WaitForInputIdle and waits for the new process to idle before returning, with a maximum timeout of 1 minute. For further discussion on when this flag is necessary, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_FLAG_DDEWAIT
member.summary: Do not use; use SEE_MASK_NOASYNC instead.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_DOENVSUBST
member.summary: Expand any environment variables specified in the string given by the lpDirectory or lpFile member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_FLAG_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display an error message box if an error occurs.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_UNICODE
member.summary: Use this flag to indicate a Unicode application.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_NO_CONSOLE
member.summary: Use to inherit the parent's console for the new process instead of having it create a new console. It is the opposite of using a CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE flag with CreateProcess.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_ASYNCOK
member.summary: The execution can be performed on a background thread and the call should return immediately without waiting for the background thread to finish. Note that in certain cases ShellExecuteEx ignores this flag and waits for the process to finish before returning.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_NOQUERYCLASSSTORE
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_HMONITOR
member.summary: Use this flag when specifying a monitor on multi-monitor systems. The monitor is specified in the hMonitor member. This flag cannot be combined with SEE_MASK_ICON.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_NOZONECHECKS
member.summary: Introduced in Windows XP. Do not perform a zone check. This flag allows ShellExecuteEx to bypass zone checking put into place by IAttachmentExecute.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_WAITFORINPUTIDLE
member.summary: After the new process is created, wait for the process to become idle before returning, with a one minute timeout. See WaitForInputIdle for more details.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_FLAG_LOG_USAGE
member.summary: Introduced in Windows XP. Keep track of the number of times this application has been launched. Applications with sufficiently high counts appear in the Start Menu's list of most frequently used programs.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SEE.SEE_MASK_FLAG_HINST_IS_SITE
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. The hInstApp member is used to specify the IUnknown of the object that will be used as a site pointer. The site pointer is used to provide services to the ShellExecute function, the handler binding process, and invoked verb handlers.

member.summary: The IShellFolder interface of the folder for which to create the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SFV_CREATE.psvOuter
member.summary: A pointer to the parent IShellView interface. This parameter may be NULL. This parameter is used only when the view created by SHCreateShellFolderView is hosted in a common dialog box.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SFV_CREATE.psfvcb
member.summary: A pointer to the IShellFolderViewCB interface that handles the view's callbacks when various events occur. This parameter may be NULL.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF
member.summary: A pointer to a value that contains flags that indicate the default column state. This parameter can include a combination of the following flags.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_STR
member.summary: A string.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_INT
member.summary: An integer.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_TYPE_DATE
member.summary: A date.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_ONBYDEFAULT
member.summary: Should be shown by default in the Windows Explorer Details view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_SLOW
member.summary: Recommends that the folder view extract column information asynchronously, on a background thread, because extracting this information can be time consuming.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_EXTENDED
member.summary: Provided by a handler, not the folder object.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_SECONDARYUI
member.summary: Not displayed in the shortcut menu, but listed in the More dialog box.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_HIDDEN
member.summary: Not displayed in the user interface.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLSTATEF.SHCOLSTATE_PREFER_VARCMP
member.summary: Uses default sorting rather than CompareIDs to get the sort order.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLUMNID
member.summary: Specifies the FMTID/PID identifier of a column that will be displayed by the Windows Explorer Details view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLUMNID.fmtid
member.summary: A property set format identifier or FMTID (a GUID). The Shell supports the storage, Shell details, and summary information property sets. Other property sets can be supported by particular folders.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCOLUMNID.pid
member.summary: The column's property identifier (PID).

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF
member.summary: Determines the types of items included in an enumeration. These values are used with the IShellFolder::EnumObjects method.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_CHECKING_FOR_CHILDREN
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The calling application is checking for the existence of child items in the folder.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FOLDERS
member.summary: Include items that are folders in the enumeration.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NONFOLDERS
member.summary: Include items that are not folders in the enumeration.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN
member.summary: Include hidden items in the enumeration. This does not include hidden system items. (To include hidden system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN.)

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INIT_ON_FIRST_NEXT
member.summary: No longer used; always assumed. IShellFolder::EnumObjects can return without validating the enumeration object. Validation can be postponed until the first call to IEnumIDList::Next. Use this flag when a user interface might be displayed prior to the first IEnumIDList::Next call. For a user interface to be presented, hwnd must be set to a valid window handle.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NETPRINTERSRCH
member.summary: The calling application is looking for printer objects.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_SHAREABLE
member.summary: The calling application is looking for resources that can be shared.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_STORAGE
member.summary: Include items with accessible storage and their ancestors, including hidden items.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NAVIGATION_ENUM
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Child folders should provide a navigation enumeration.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FASTITEMS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The calling application is looking for resources that can be enumerated quickly.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FLATLIST
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Enumerate items as a simple list even if the folder itself is not structured in that way.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_ENABLE_ASYNC
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The calling application is monitoring for change notifications. This means that the enumerator does not have to return all results. Items can be reported through change notifications.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Include hidden system items in the enumeration. This value does not include hidden non-system items. (To include hidden non-system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN.)

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLDETAILS
member.summary: Reports detailed information on an item in a Shell folder.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLDETAILS.fmt
member.summary: The alignment of the column heading and the subitem text in the column.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLDETAILS.cxChar
member.summary: The number of average-sized characters in the header.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLDETAILS.str
member.summary: An STRRET structure that includes a string with the requested information. To convert this structure to a string, use StrRetToBuf or StrRetToStr.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO
member.summary: Contains information used by ShellExecuteEx.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.cbSize
member.summary: Required. The size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.fMask
member.summary: Flags that indicate the content and validity of the other structure members.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hwnd
member.summary: Optional. A handle to the parent window, used to display any message boxes that the system might produce while executing this function. This value can be NULL.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpVerb
member.summary: A string, referred to as a verb, that specifies the action to be performed. The set of available verbs depends on the particular file or folder. Generally, the actions available from an object's shortcut menu are available verbs. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the default verb is used if available. If not, the "open" verb is used. If neither verb is available, the system uses the first verb listed in the registry.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpFile
member.summary: The address of a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the file or object on which ShellExecuteEx will perform the action specified by the lpVerb parameter. The system registry verbs that are supported by the ShellExecuteEx function include "open" for executable files and document files and "print" for document files for which a print handler has been registered. Other applications might have added Shell verbs through the system registry, such as "play" for .avi and .wav files. To specify a Shell namespace object, pass the fully qualified parse name and set the SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST flag in the fMask parameter.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpParameters
member.summary: Optional. The address of a null-terminated string that contains the application parameters. The parameters must be separated by spaces. If the lpFile member specifies a document file, lpParameters should be NULL.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpDirectory
member.summary: Optional. The address of a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the working directory. If this member is NULL, the current directory is used as the working directory.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.nShow
member.summary: Required. Flags that specify how an application is to be shown when it is opened; one of the SW_ values listed for the ShellExecute function. If lpFile specifies a document file, the flag is simply passed to the associated application. It is up to the application to decide how to handle it.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hInstApp
member.summary: [out] If SEE_MASK_NOCLOSEPROCESS is set and the ShellExecuteEx call succeeds, it sets this member to a value greater than 32. If the function fails, it is set to an SE_ERR_XXX error value that indicates the cause of the failure. Although hInstApp is declared as an HINSTANCE for compatibility with 16-bit Windows applications, it is not a true HINSTANCE. It can be cast only to an int and compared to either 32 or the following SE_ERR_XXX error codes.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpIDList
member.summary: The address of an absolute ITEMIDLIST structure (PCIDLIST_ABSOLUTE) to contain an item identifier list that uniquely identifies the file to execute. This member is ignored if the fMask member does not include SEE_MASK_IDLIST or SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpClass
member.summary: The address of a null-terminated string that specifies one of the following: A ProgId. For example, "Paint.Picture". A URI protocol scheme. For example, "http". A file extension. For example, ".txt". A registry path under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT that names a subkey that contains one or more Shell verbs. This key will have a subkey that conforms to the Shell verb registry schema, such as shell\verb name

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hkeyClass
member.summary: A handle to the registry key for the file type. The access rights for this registry key should be set to KEY_READ. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.dwHotKey
member.summary: A keyboard shortcut to associate with the application. The low-order word is the virtual key code, and the high-order word is a modifier flag (HOTKEYF_). For a list of modifier flags, see the description of the WM_SETHOTKEY message. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_HOTKEY.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hIcon
member.summary: A handle to the icon for the file type. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_ICON. This value is used only in Windows XP and earlier. It is ignored as of Windows Vista.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hProcess
member.summary: A handle to the monitor upon which the document is to be displayed. This member is ignored if fMask does not include SEE_MASK_HMONITOR.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHFILEINFO
member.summary: Contains information about a file object.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHFILEINFO.hIcon
member.summary: A handle to the icon that represents the file. You are responsible for destroying this handle with DestroyIcon when you no longer need it.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHFILEINFO.iIcon
member.summary: The index of the icon image within the system image list.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHFILEINFO.dwAttributes
member.summary: An array of values that indicates the attributes of the file object. For information about these values, see the IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf method.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHFILEINFO.szDisplayName
member.summary: A string that contains the name of the file as it appears in the Windows Shell, or the path and file name of the file that contains the icon representing the file.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHFILEINFO.szTypeName
member.summary: A string that describes the type of file.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHGDNF
member.summary: Defines the values used with the IShellFolder::GetDisplayNameOf and IShellFolder::SetNameOf methods to specify the type of file or folder names used by those methods.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGDNF.SHGDN_NORMAL
member.summary: When not combined with another flag, return the parent-relative name that identifies the item, suitable for displaying to the user. This name often does not include extra information such as the file name extension and does not need to be unique. This name might include information that identifies the folder that contains the item. For instance, this flag could cause IShellFolder::GetDisplayNameOf to return the string "username (on Machine)" for a particular user's folder.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGDNF.SHGDN_INFOLDER
member.summary: The name is relative to the folder from which the request was made. This is the name display to the user when used in the context of the folder. For example, it is used in the view and in the address bar path segment for the folder. This name should not include disambiguation informationâ€”for instance "username" instead of "username (on Machine)" for a particular user's folder. Use this flag in combinations with SHGDN_FORPARSING and SHGDN_FOREDITING.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FOREDITING
member.summary: The name is used for in-place editing when the user renames the item.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FORADDRESSBAR
member.summary: The name is displayed in an address bar combo box.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGDNF.SHGDN_FORPARSING
member.summary: The name is used for parsing. That is, it can be passed to IShellFolder::ParseDisplayName to recover the object's PIDL. The form this name takes depends on the particular object. When SHGDN_FORPARSING is used alone, the name is relative to the desktop. When combined with SHGDN_INFOLDER, the name is relative to the folder from which the request was made.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI
member.summary: The flags that specify the file information to retrieve.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_ICON
member.summary: Retrieve the handle to the icon that represents the file and the index of the icon within the system image list. The handle is copied to the hIcon member of the structure specified by psfi, and the index is copied to the iIcon member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_DISPLAYNAME
member.summary: Retrieve the display name for the file. The name is copied to the szDisplayName member of the structure specified in psfi. The returned display name uses the long file name, if there is one, rather than the 8.3 form of the file name.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_TYPENAME
member.summary: Retrieve the string that describes the file's type. The string is copied to the szTypeName member of the structure specified in psfi.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Retrieve the item attributes. The attributes are copied to the dwAttributes member of the structure specified in the psfi parameter. These are the same attributes that are obtained from IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_ICONLOCATION
member.summary: Retrieve the name of the file that contains the icon representing the file specified by pszPath, as returned by the IExtractIcon::GetIconLocation method of the file's icon handler. Also retrieve the icon index within that file. The name of the file containing the icon is copied to the szDisplayName member of the structure specified by psfi. The icon's index is copied to that structure's iIcon member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_EXETYPE
member.summary: Retrieve the type of the executable file if pszPath identifies an executable file. The information is packed into the return value. This flag cannot be specified with any other flags.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX
member.summary: Retrieve the index of a system image list icon. If successful, the index is copied to the iIcon member of psfi. The return value is a handle to the system image list. Only those images whose indices are successfully copied to iIcon are valid. Attempting to access other images in the system image list will result in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_LINKOVERLAY
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to add the link overlay to the file's icon. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_SELECTED
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to blend the file's icon with the system highlight color. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_ATTR_SPECIFIED
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ATTRIBUTES to indicate that the dwAttributes member of the SHFILEINFO structure at psfi contains the specific attributes that are desired. These attributes are passed to IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf. If this flag is not specified, 0xFFFFFFFF is passed to IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf, requesting all attributes. This flag cannot be specified with the SHGFI_ICON flag.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_LARGEICON
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve the file's large icon. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_SMALLICON
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve the file's small icon. Also used to modify SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX, causing the function to return the handle to the system image list that contains small icon images. The SHGFI_ICON and/or SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_OPENICON
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve the file's open icon. Also used to modify SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX, causing the function to return the handle to the system image list that contains the file's small open icon. A container object displays an open icon to indicate that the container is open. The SHGFI_ICON and/or SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_SHELLICONSIZE
member.summary: Modify SHGFI_ICON, causing the function to retrieve a Shell-sized icon. If this flag is not specified the function sizes the icon according to the system metric values. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_PIDL
member.summary: Indicate that pszPath is the address of an ITEMIDLIST structure rather than a path name.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_USEFILEATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Indicates that the function should not attempt to access the file specified by pszPath. Rather, it should act as if the file specified by pszPath exists with the file attributes passed in dwFileAttributes. This flag cannot be combined with the SHGFI_ATTRIBUTES, SHGFI_EXETYPE, or SHGFI_PIDL flags.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_ADDOVERLAYS
member.summary: Version 5.0. Apply the appropriate overlays to the file's icon. The SHGFI_ICON flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SHGFI.SHGFI_OVERLAYINDEX
member.summary: Version 5.0. Return the index of the overlay icon. The value of the overlay index is returned in the upper eight bits of the iIcon member of the structure specified by psfi. This flag requires that the SHGFI_ICON be set as well.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SIZE
member.summary: The SIZE structure specifies the width and height of a rectangle.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SIZE.cx
member.summary: Specifies the rectangle's width. The units depend on which function uses this.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SIZE.cy
member.summary: Specifies the rectangle's height. The units depend on which function uses this.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET
member.summary: Contains strings returned from the IShellFolder interface methods.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.CreateUnicode(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a unicode from a string.
member.param: The string.
member.returns: A unicode allocated on the shell allocator.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.GetStringValue
member.summary: Gets the actual string value of a STRRET.
member.returns: The string represented by the STRRET.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.uType
member.summary: A value that specifies the desired format of the string.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.data
member.summary: The string data.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.STRRETTYPE
member.summary: A value that specifies the desired format of the string. This can be one of the following values.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.STRRETTYPE.STRRET_WSTR
member.summary: The string is at the address specified by pOleStr member.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.STRRETTYPE.STRRET_OFFSET
member.summary: The uOffset member value indicates the number of bytes from the beginning of the item identifier list where the string is located.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.STRRET.STRRETTYPE.STRRET_CSTR
member.summary: The string is returned in the cStr member.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.SVUIA_STATUS
member.summary: Used with the IBrowserService2::_UIActivateView method to set the state of a browser view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SVUIA_STATUS.SVUIA_DEACTIVATE
member.summary: Windows Explorer is about to destroy the Shell view window. The Shell view should remove all extended user interfaces. These are typically merged menus and merged modeless pop-up windows.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SVUIA_STATUS.SVUIA_ACTIVATE_NOFOCUS
member.summary: The Shell view is losing the input focus, or it has just been created without the input focus. The Shell view should be able to set menu items appropriate for the nonfocused state. This means no selection-specific items should be added.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SVUIA_STATUS.SVUIA_ACTIVATE_FOCUS
member.summary: Windows Explorer has just created the view window with the input focus. This means the Shell view should be able to set menu items appropriate for the focused state.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.SVUIA_STATUS.SVUIA_INPLACEACTIVATE
member.summary: The Shell view is active without focus. This flag is only used when UIActivate is exposed through the IShellView2 interface.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.TBBUTTON
member.summary: Contains information about a button in a toolbar. TODO: This struct has different sizes on Windows x86 and x64, validate that it works in both modes.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.TBBUTTON.iBitmap
member.summary: Zero-based index of the button image. Set this member to I_IMAGECALLBACK, and the toolbar will send the TBN_GETDISPINFO notification code to retrieve the image index when it is needed. Version 5.81. Set this member to I_IMAGENONE to indicate that the button does not have an image. The button layout will not include any space for a bitmap, only text. If the button is a separator, that is, if fsStyle is set to BTNS_SEP, iBitmap determines the width of the separator, in pixels. For information on selecting button images from image lists, see TB_SETIMAGELIST message.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.TBBUTTON.idCommand
member.summary: Command identifier associated with the button. This identifier is used in a WM_COMMAND message when the button is chosen.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.TBBUTTON.dwData
member.summary: Application-defined value.

member.name: P:SharpShell.Interop.TBBUTTON.fsState
member.summary: Button state flags. This member can be a combination of the values listed in Toolbar Button States.

member.name: P:SharpShell.Interop.TBBUTTON.fsStyle
member.summary: Button style. This member can be a combination of the button style values listed in Toolbar Control and Button Styles.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.WTS_ALPHATYPE
member.summary: Alpha channel type information.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The bitmap is an unknown format. The Shell tries nonetheless to detect whether the image has an alpha channel.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_RGB
member.summary: The bitmap is an RGB image without alpha. The alpha channel is invalid and the Shell ignores it.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_ARGB
member.summary: The bitmap is an ARGB image with a valid alpha channel.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop._SVGIO
member.summary: Used with the IFolderView::Items, IFolderView::ItemCount, and IShellView::GetItemObject methods to restrict or control the items in their collections.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVGIO.SVGIO_BACKGROUND
member.summary: Refers to the background of the view. It is used with IID_IContextMenu to get a shortcut menu for the view background and with IID_IDispatch to get a dispatch interface that represents the ShellFolderView object for the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVGIO.SVGIO_SELECTION
member.summary: Refers to the currently selected items. Used with IID_IDataObject to retrieve a data object that represents the selected items.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVGIO.SVGIO_ALLVIEW
member.summary: Used in the same way as SVGIO_SELECTION but refers to all items in the view.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVGIO.SVGIO_CHECKED
member.summary: Used in the same way as SVGIO_SELECTION but refers to checked items in views where checked mode is supported. For more details on checked mode, see FOLDERFLAGS.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVGIO.SVGIO_TYPE_MASK
member.summary: Used in the same way as SVGIO_SELECTION but refers to checked items in views where checked mode is supported. For more details on checked mode, see FOLDERFLAGS.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVGIO.SVGIO_FLAG_VIEWORDER
member.summary: Returns the items in the order they appear in the view. If this flag is not set, the selected item will be listed first.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF
member.summary: Indicates flags used by IFolderView, IFolderView2, IShellView and IShellView2 to specify a type of selection to apply.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_DESELECT
member.summary: Deselect the item.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_SELECT
member.summary: Select the item.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_EDIT
member.summary: Put the name of the item into rename mode. This value includes SVSI_SELECT.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_DESELECTOTHERS
member.summary: Deselect all but the selected item. If the item parameter is NULL, deselect all items.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_ENSUREVISIBLE
member.summary: In the case of a folder that cannot display all of its contents on one screen, display the portion that contains the selected item.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_FOCUSED
member.summary: Give the selected item the focus when multiple items are selected, placing the item first in any list of the collection returned by a method.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_TRANSLATEPT
member.summary: Convert the input point from screen coordinates to the list-view client coordinates.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_SELECTIONMARK
member.summary: Mark the item so that it can be queried using IFolderView::GetSelectionMarkedItem.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_POSITIONITEM
member.summary: Allows the window's default view to position the item. In most cases, this will place the item in the first available position. However, if the call comes during the processing of a mouse-positioned context menu, the position of the context menu is used to position the item.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_CHECK
member.summary: The item should be checked. This flag is used with items in views where the checked mode is supported.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_CHECK2
member.summary: The second check state when the view is in tri-check mode, in which there are three values for the checked state. You can indicate tri-check mode by specifying FWF_TRICHECKSELECT in IFolderView2::SetCurrentFolderFlags. The 3 states for FWF_TRICHECKSELECT are unchecked, SVSI_CHECK and SVSI_CHECK2.

member.name: F:SharpShell.Interop._SVSIF.SVSI_KEYBOARDSELECT
member.summary: Selects the item and marks it as selected by the keyboard. This value includes SVSI_SELECT.

member.summary: Gets the location and index of an icon.
member.param: One or more of the following values. This parameter can also be NULL.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the icon location. The icon location is a null-terminated string that identifies the file that contains the icon.
The size of the buffer, in characters, pointed to by pszIconFile.
A pointer to an int that receives the index of the icon in the file pointed to by pszIconFile.
A pointer to a UINT value that receives zero or a combination of the following value

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpIconHandler.SharpIconHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IExtractIconA#Extract(System.String,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Extracts an icon image from the specified location.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the icon location.
The index of the icon in the file pointed to by pszFile.
A pointer to an HICON value that receives the handle to the large icon. This parameter may be NULL.
A pointer to an HICON value that receives the handle to the small icon. This parameter may be NULL.

The desired size of the icon, in pixels. The low word contains the size of the large icon, and the high word contains the size of the small icon. The size specified can be the width or height. The width of an icon always equals its height.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the function extracted the icon, or S_FALSE if the calling application should extract the icon.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellFolderImpl.SharpShell#Interop#IShellFolder#ParseDisplayName(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.UInt32@,System.IntPtr@,SharpShell.Interop.SFGAO@)
member.summary: Translates the display name of a file object or a folder into an item identifier list.
member.param: A window handle. The client should provide a window handle if it displays a dialog or message box. Otherwise set hwnd to NULL.
Optional. A pointer to a bind context used to pass parameters as inputs and outputs to the parsing function.
A null-terminated Unicode string with the display name.

A pointer to a ULONG value that receives the number of characters of the display name that was parsed. If your application does not need this information, set pchEaten to NULL, and no value will be returned.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the PIDL for the object.
The value used to query for file attributes. If not used, it should be set to NULL.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellFolderImpl.SharpShell#Interop#IShellFolder#EnumObjects(System.IntPtr,SharpShell.Interop.SHCONTF,SharpShell.Interop.IEnumIDList@)
member.summary: Allows a client to determine the contents of a folder by creating an item identifier enumeration object and returning its IEnumIDList interface. Return value: error code, if any
member.param: If user input is required to perform the enumeration, this window handle should be used by the enumeration object as the parent window to take user input.
Flags indicating which items to include in the enumeration. For a list of possible values, see the SHCONTF enum.
Address that receives a pointer to the IEnumIDList interface of the enumeration object created by this method.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellFolderImpl.SharpShell#Interop#IShellFolder#BindToStorage(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Guid@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Requests a pointer to an object's storage interface. Return value: error code, if any
member.param: Address of an ITEMIDLIST structure that identifies the subfolder relative to its parent folder.
Optional address of an IBindCtx interface on a bind context object to be used during this operation.
Interface identifier (IID) of the requested storage interface.
Address that receives the interface pointer specified by riid.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellFolderImpl.SharpShell#Interop#IShellFolder#CompareIDs(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines the relative order of two file objects or folders, given their item identifier lists. Return value: If this method is successful, the CODE field of the HRESULT contains one of the following values (the code can be retrived using the helper function GetHResultCode): Negative A negative return value indicates that the first item should precede the second (pidl1 < pidl2). Positive A positive return value indicates that the first item should follow the second (pidl1 > pidl2). Zero A return value of zero indicates that the two items are the same (pidl1 = pidl2).
member.param: Value that specifies how the comparison should be performed. The lower Sixteen bits of lParam define the sorting rule. The upper sixteen bits of lParam are used for flags that modify the sorting rule. values can be from the SHCIDS enum
Pointer to the first item's ITEMIDLIST structure.
Pointer to the second item's ITEMIDLIST structure.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellNamespaceFolderIdListEnumerator.Next(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified number of item identifiers in the enumeration sequence and advances the current position by the number of items retrieved.
member.param: Number of elements in the array pointed to by the rgelt parameter.

Address of an array of ITEMIDLIST pointers that receives the item identifiers. The implementation must allocate these item identifiers using the Shell's allocator (retrieved by the SHGetMalloc function). The calling application is responsible for freeing the item identifiers using the Shell's allocator.

Address of a value that receives a count of the item identifiers actually returned in rgelt. The count can be smaller than the value specified in the celt parameter. This parameter can be NULL only if celt is one.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellNamespaceFolderIdListEnumerator.Skip(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Skips over the specified number of elements in the enumeration sequence.
member.param: Number of item identifiers to skip.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellNamespaceFolderIdListEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Returns to the beginning of the enumeration sequence.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpNamespaceExtension.ShellNamespaceFolderIdListEnumerator.Clone(SharpShell.Interop.IEnumIDList@)
member.summary: Creates a new item enumeration object with the same contents and state as the current one.
member.param: Address of a pointer to the new enumeration object. The calling application must eventually free the new object by calling its Release member function.

member.name: P:SharpShell.SharpPreviewHandler.PreviewHandlerAttribute.DisableLowILProcessIsolation
member.summary: Disables low IL process isolation. Default is false. By default, preview handlers run in a low integrity level (IL) process for security reasons. You can optionally disable running as a low IL process by setting the following value in the registry. However, it is not recommended to do so. Systems could eventually be configured to reject any process that is not low IL.
member.value: true if low IL process isolation should be disabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SharpShell.SharpPreviewHandler.PreviewHandlerAttribute.SurrogateHostType
member.summary: Gets or sets the surrogate host type. Changing this from the default of SurrogateHostType.DedicatedPrevhost is not recommended.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpPreviewHandler.SharpPreviewHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IObjectWithSite#GetSite(System.Guid@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves the latest site passed using SetSite.
member.param: The IID of the interface pointer that should be returned in ppvSite.

Address of pointer variable that receives the interface pointer requested in riid. Upon successful return, *ppvSite contains the requested interface pointer to the site last seen in SetSite. The specific interface returned depends on the riid argumentâ€”in essence, the two arguments act identically to those in QueryInterface. If the appropriate interface pointer is available, the object must call AddRef on that pointer before returning successfully. If no site is available, or the requested interface is not supported, this method must *ppvSite to NULL and return a failure code.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpPreviewHandler.SharpPreviewHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IObjectWithSite#SetSite(System.Object)
member.summary: Enables a container to pass an object a pointer to the interface for its site.
member.param: A pointer to the IUnknown interface pointer of the site managing this object. If NULL, the object should call Release on any existing site at which point the object no longer knows its site.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpPreviewHandler.SharpPreviewHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IPreviewHandler#TranslateAccelerator(SharpShell.Interop.MSG)
member.summary: Directs the preview handler to handle a keystroke passed up from the message pump of the process in which the preview handler is running.
member.param: A pointer to a window message.
member.returns: If the keystroke message can be processed by the preview handler, the handler will process it and return S_OK. If the preview handler cannot process the keystroke message, it will offer it to the host using TranslateAccelerator. If the host processes the message, this method will return S_OK. If the host does not process the message, this method will return S_FALSE.

member.name: T:SharpShell.SharpThumbnailHandler.SharpThumbnailHandler
member.summary: The SharpIconHandler is the base class for SharpShell servers that provide custom Thumbnail Image Handlers.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpThumbnailHandler.SharpThumbnailHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IThumbnailProvider#GetThumbnail(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,SharpShell.Interop.WTS_ALPHATYPE@)
member.summary: Gets a thumbnail image and alpha type.
member.param: The maximum thumbnail size, in pixels. The Shell draws the returned bitmap at this size or smaller. The returned bitmap should fit into a square of width and height cx, though it does not need to be a square image. The Shell scales the bitmap to render at lower sizes. For example, if the image has a 6:4 aspect ratio, then the returned bitmap should also have a 6:4 aspect ratio.

When this method returns, contains a pointer to the thumbnail image handle. The image must be a DIB section and 32 bits per pixel. The Shell scales down the bitmap if its width or height is larger than the size specified by cx. The Shell always respects the aspect ratio and never scales a bitmap larger than its original size.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to one of the following values from the WTS_ALPHATYPE enumeration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpThumbnailHandler.SharpThumbnailHandler.GetThumbnailImage(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the thumbnail image for the currently selected item (SelectedItemStream).
member.param: The width of the image that should be returned.
member.returns: The image for the thumbnail.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpDropHandler.SharpDropHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IDropTarget#DragEnter(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject,System.UInt32,SharpShell.Interop.POINT,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Indicates whether a drop can be accepted, and, if so, the effect of the drop.
member.param: A pointer to the IDataObject interface on the data object. This data object contains the data being transferred in the drag-and-drop operation. If the drop occurs, this data object will be incorporated into the target.

The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Possible values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A POINTL structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.

On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the DoDragDrop function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpDropHandler.SharpDropHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IDropTarget#DragOver(System.UInt32,SharpShell.Interop.POINT,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Provides target feedback to the user and communicates the drop's effect to the DoDragDrop function so it can communicate the effect of the drop back to the source.
member.param: The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Valid values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A POINTL structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.

On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the DoDragDrop function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: M:SharpShell.SharpDropHandler.SharpDropHandler.SharpShell#Interop#IDropTarget#DragLeave
member.summary: Removes target feedback and releases the data object.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.summary: Incorporates the source data into the target window, removes target feedback, and releases the data object.
member.param: A pointer to the IDataObject interface on the data object being transferred in the drag-and-drop operation.

The current state of the keyboard modifier keys on the keyboard. Possible values can be a combination of any of the flags MK_CONTROL, MK_SHIFT, MK_ALT, MK_BUTTON, MK_LBUTTON, MK_MBUTTON, and MK_RBUTTON.
A POINTL structure containing the current cursor coordinates in screen coordinates.

On input, pointer to the value of the pdwEffect parameter of the DoDragDrop function. On return, must contain one of the DROPEFFECT flags, which indicates what the result of the drop operation would be.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: T:SharpShell.Interop.IQueryInfo
member.summary: Exposes methods that the Shell uses to retrieve flags and info tip information for an item that resides in an IShellFolder implementation. Info tips are usually displayed inside a tooltip control.

member.name: M:SharpShell.Interop.IQueryInfo.GetInfoTip(SharpShell.Interop.QITIPF,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the info tip text for an item.
member.param: Flags that direct the handling of the item from which you're retrieving the info tip text. This value is commonly zero.

he address of a Unicode string pointer that, when this method returns successfully, receives the tip string pointer. Applications that implement this method must allocate memory for ppwszTip by calling CoTaskMemAlloc. Calling applications must call CoTaskMemFree to free the memory when it is no longer needed.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the function succeeds. If no info tip text is available, ppwszTip is set to NULL. Otherwise, returns a COM-defined error value.

member.param: A pointer to a value that receives the flags for the item. If no flags are to be returned, this value should be set to zero.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if the function succeeds. If no info tip text is available, ppwszTip is set to NULL. Otherwise, returns a COM-defined error value.
